p: There are studies that used essential oils in food as natural preservatives to improve food safety and quality, replacing harmful synthetic food preservatives [ 49, 82]. Herculano et al. [ 82] encapsulated eucalyptus and determined the antimicrobial actions of the loaded nanoparticles on Listeria monocytogenes and Salmonella enteritidis bacteria. The authors observed that the nanoparticle bactericidal action was more effective against gram-positive than gram-negative bacteria, as the nanoencapsulated oil exhibited enhanced activity against S. enteritidis; these nanoparticles can be used in foods for natural preservation.
